review: I purchased the Fire Stick for my mom for Christmas.  Did not receive before Christmas, I'm sure because of demand.  My mom LOVES it!!!!  She had been watching Netflix on a tablet and loves watching now on her larger screen.  My mom is in her 70's and Dad is in his 80's after a few tutorials from my 14 year old daughter they navigate the user interface like pros.  I'm very happy with the purchase!
author: Glenda L Johnston

review: I've had the stick since Christmas so I can give an adequate review.  Pass on this device.It doesn't support most Surround Sound formats and requires the audio be sent via direct play.  This wouldn't really be that big of a deal, but it only support audio passthrough in a single format (MP4).  I have several TBs of MKV files I can't even watch because the Fire Stick is too stupid to just pass the audio to my receiver.  What a joke.Get a Roku Stick.  It's $10 more dollars, but at least it supports a far wider range of audio and video formats.
author: Fill in the Blank

I so want to love this.

review: Doesn't easily connect  with Android phones;  I couldn't get my LG3 phone connected to the device even after advice from tech support people.  This wouldn't be a huge issue except the lack of apps for popular things like HBOgo, comedy central , etc means that it's basically a stick for watching netflix and prime and youtube.  If you're looking for a streaming stick I'd recommend buying any other product.
